document_title: Epididymitis: Causes, symptoms, diagnosis and prevention
subsection_content:
There is no way to completely prevent epididymitis in humans. However, men can still practice optimal disease prevention by managing their urinary health, sexual habits and good body hygiene.
Some ways to help men prevent epididymitis:
Use condoms during sex. At the same time, stay aware and practice safe sex to prevent STDs; Circumcision at appropriate and prescribed ages; Keep the surrounding environment clean, especially the bathroom and restroom areas; Fully vaccinated against STDs, mumps, and tuberculosis

Epididymitis is a disease that occurs when the upper coiled tube of the testicle appears swollen, with or without pus discharge. The disease causes tight pain in the testicles and epididymis, sometimes spreading to the patient's abdomen, causing inconvenience in daily life and a high risk of infertility later.
The majority of causes of epididymitis are infections from sexually transmitted diseases (STDs). Therefore, men can prevent the disease by practicing safe sex, limiting the number of sexual partners and maintaining good genital hygiene as well as good bathroom and restroom environments.
